qas.question: Where is Valencia's City Hall located?
What is on the eastern side of Valencia's largest plaza?
What shape is the Plaza del Ayuntamiento?
What is in the north part of the plaza?
When are firewords heard every day?

context: The largest plaza in Valencia is the <a0_0>Plaza del Ayuntamiento<a0_0/>; it is home to the City Hall (Ayuntamiento) on its western side and <a1_0>the central post office<a1_0/> (Edificio de Correos) on its eastern side, a cinema that shows classic movies, and many restaurants and bars. The plaza is <a2_0>triangular<a2_0/> in shape, with a large cement lot at the southern end, normally surrounded by flower vendors. It serves as ground zero <a4_0>during the Les Falles<a4_0/> when the fireworks of the Mascletà can be heard every afternoon. There is <a3_0>a large fountain<a3_0/> at the northern end.
